reviews.review_msg: He is a great professor, hilarious and makes his students feel comfortable in class. The only reason I am not retaking his classes is that the requirements for his assignments are not clear and too broad for me. However, some students feel that his assignments were acceptable. He is a bit of a tough grader on his essays.

Aspires to break from standard system models of university, encouraging back and forth between students and professor. He enjoys the idea of meeting for lunch with as much of the class as possible to encourage this form of learning. Fair marker, challenges you without sinking you.

I did not find that visiting him during his office hours helped my grade, either for the essay or the exam. The material on the quizzes WASN'T self-evident - though I attempted to read the texts thoroughly. The final exam was even worse than the quizzes (for the same reason).. I will go out of my way to not take a class with this teacher again.

Tied (with Brook) as my favorite prof in the Humanities department. She does best in 200 level classes where she can interact with the students. She's low stress, fair with tests and discussion and provokes great thoughts in the process. HIGHLY recommended.

Chris is amazing.  She is so caring and wants the best for her students.  She's a great teacher, structures her classes well, and really knows her material; but, even more important than that, she is so inspiring.  She makes you want to learn more and do well.
